intro: Calandrinia berteroana, commonly known as the "firecracker flower," is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvidae family and is characterized by its vibrant red, orange, or yellow tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its leaves are succulent, which helps it retain moisture in its native habitat. Calandrinia berteroana is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking and long-lasting blooms.
